channel.title: NPC Animations. [Attack, block, death?]
channel.description:
Hello. (This is for a 317 server)
I am in search of the animations for NPCs, i have obtained an NPC dump list, but need a few bits of help.
anInt77 is the walk animation, right.
So which of the following ints is which? I don't know which is attack, block etc etc..
[code] anInt69 anInt71 anInt74 anInt75 anInt79 anInt83 anInt85 anInt86 anInt90 anInt91 anInt92 anInt96 [/code]
Any one know any of these? Thanks.

item.title: NPC Animations. [Attack, block, death?]
item.dc:creator: @WRX WRX`
item.description:
@WRX wrote:

Thanks for saving my time

Read full topic

item.title: NPC Animations. [Attack, block, death?]
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

if (cmd.startsWith("emote")) { try { anim(Integer.parseInt(cmd.substring(6))); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } catch (Exception e) { Message("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::emote #"); } }

Read full topic

item.title: NPC Animations. [Attack, block, death?]
item.dc:creator: @WRX WRX`
item.description:
@WRX wrote:

`Rich:

Just take the walk animation, and search around them using a test command.

Don’t got a test command, and besides the point of making one, hows that going to work?
Use the “man” NPCs ints values? Im guessing so, since they are just the human ones i think.

@ Legend-scape: If your not gonna post anything useful, dont post ffs.

Read full topic
